keyword: how many calories in chicken thigh meat
title: How Many Calories in Chicken Thigh Meat?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in chicken thigh meat per 100g, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown for easy tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in Chicken Thigh Meat?
assumptions: Skinless, boneless chicken thigh meat, cooked (roasted), no added fats, oils, or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by cut, cooking method, brand, and preparation; values are approximate. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of cooked chicken thigh meat provides about 177 kcal and 24g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Bone-in, cooked (adjust for edible meat only)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g chicken thigh meat?
faqs.a: Approximately 177 kcal for cooked, skinless chicken thigh meat.

faqs.q: Is chicken thigh meat high in protein?
faqs.a: Yes, about 24g protein per 100g, making it a lean protein source.

faqs.q: How does chicken thigh compare to breast in calories?
faqs.a: Thigh has more fat and calories (177 kcal/100g) than breast (165 kcal/100g skinless cooked).

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in chicken thigh meat?
faqs.a: Yes; roasting keeps it lower, while frying or skin-on adds 40-50 kcal per 100g.

faqs.q: What about carbs in chicken thigh meat?
faqs.a: Zero carbs, fiber, or sugars per 100g under standard preparation.
